definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Thus, neurophysiologists tell us that lobsters do not process pain.
sentences.chinese: 但是，神經生理學家告訴我們龍蝦感知不到疼痛。

sentences.english: The answers, some exercise physiologists say, are not always what you might expect.
sentences.chinese: 一些運動生理學家的答案並非如你所想。

sentences.english: There are some tricks, exercise physiologists say, but also some risks.
sentences.chinese: 運動生理學家指出，其中有些訣竅，但也有些風險。

sentences.english: The physiologist recently studied indicated that evening exercises beneficially .
sentences.chinese: 生理學家新近研究表明，傍晚鍛鍊最爲有益。

sentences.english: Animal physiologists have done beautiful work on the anatomy of this sensory system.
sentences.chinese: 動物生理學家對這一感覺系統進行了完善的解剖研究。

sentences.english: Immunoassays are the tests physiologists have traditionally used in such studies.
sentences.chinese: 免疫測定法是生理學家在類似研究中傳統使用的方法。

sentences.english: Immunoassays are the tests physiologists hae traditionally used in such studies.
sentences.chinese: 免疫測定法是生理學家在類似研究中傳統使用的方法。

sentences.english: He said, "Oh, well, he's a very eminent muscle electrophysiologist. " I said, "Muscle?
sentences.chinese: 他說，“喔，他是一個非常出色的肌肉電生理學家。”
